newsitem.title: UK: Grand Met up after LVMH stake purchase.
newsitem.headline: Grand Met up after LVMH stake purchase.

text.p: Shares in Grand Metropolitan Plc rose in pre-market trade on Wednesday, after France's LVMH said after Tuesday's UK market close that it had bought shares in the food and drinks group.
Grand Met shares were marked up 10-1/2p at 591-1/2 by 0714 GMT in thin trade of 5,272 shares.

The purchase added a further complicating factor to the planned merger of Grand Met and Guinness Plc, where LVMH holds a 14.2 percent stake, though LVMH said it had no intention of making an offer for Grand Met.
The French group bought 4.75 million Grand Met shares at an average price of 577p per share.

LVMH last week requested arbitration to settle a dispute with Guinness. The French group contends it has the right to buy Guinness's stake in their joint distribution ventures and in champagne and spirits group Moet Hennessy if the merger goes ahead.
Yet dealers and analysts were puzzled by the stake purchase. "I am just as baffled as everyone else," said one analyst, who asked not to be named. "LVMH may just be trading the shares."
The head of trading at another brokerage also described it as a "strange move" that was difficult to make sense of.
"Maybe LVMH has got something up its sleeve, but what it is we just don't know," he said.
